identification.productDoi: Digital Object Identifier (DOI) for the product
identification.productVersion: Product version which represents the structure of the product and the science content governed by the algorithm, input data, and processing parameters
identification.productSpecificationVersion: Product specification version which represents the schema of this product
identification.zeroDopplerStartTime: Azimuth start time (in UTC) of the product in the format YYYY-mm-ddTHH:MM:SS.sssssssss
identification.zeroDopplerEndTime: Azimuth stop time (in UTC) of the product in the format YYYY-mm-ddTHH:MM:SS.sssssssss
identification.plannedDatatakeId: List of planned datatakes included in the product
identification.plannedObservationId: List of planned observations included in the product
identification.isUrgentObservation: Flag indicating if observation is nominal ("False") or urgent ("True")
identification.listOfFrequencies: List of frequency layers available in the product
identification.listOfObservationModes: List of observation modes of the input L0B granules (one mode per L0B)
identification.diagnosticModeFlag: Indicates if the radar operation mode is a diagnostic mode (1-2) or DBFed science (0): 0, 1, or 2
identification.productLevel: Product level. "L0A": Unprocessed instrument data; "L0B": Reformatted, unprocessed instrument data; "L1": Processed instrument data in radar coordinates system; and "L2": Processed instrument data in geocoded coordinates system
identification.isGeocoded: Flag to indicate if the product data is in the radar geometry ("False") or in the map geometry ("True")
identification.boundingPolygon: OGR compatible WKT representing the bounding polygon of the image. Horizontal coordinates are WGS84 longitude followed by latitude (both in degrees), and the vertical coordinate is the height above the WGS84 ellipsoid in meters. The first point corresponds to the start-time, near-range radar coordinate, and the perimeter is traversed in counterclockwise order on the map. This means the traversal order in radar coordinates differs for left-looking and right-looking sensors. The polygon includes the four corners of the radar grid, with equal numbers of points distributed evenly in radar coordinates along each edge
identification.processingDateTime: Processing date and time (in UTC) in the format YYYY-mm-ddTHH:MM:SS
identification.platformName: Name of the platform used to collect the remote sensing data provided in this product
identification.instrumentName: Name of the instrument used to collect the remote sensing data provided in this product
identification.processingType: Processing pipeline used to generate this granule. "Nominal": standard production system; "Urgent": time-sensitive processing in response to urgent response events; "Custom": user-initiated processing outside the nominal production system
identification.isDithered: "True" if the pulse timing was varied (dithered) during acquisition, "False" otherwise
identification.isMixedMode: "True" if this product is a composite of data collected in multiple radar modes, "False" otherwise
identification.isFullFrame: "True" if the product fully covers a NISAR frame, "False" if partial coverage
identification.compositeReleaseId: Unique version identifier of the science data production system
identification.isJointObservation: "True" if any portion of this product was acquired in a joint observation mode (e.g., L-band and S-band simultaneously), "False" otherwise

swaths.zeroDopplerTime: Vector of zero Doppler azimuth times measured relative to a UTC epoch
swaths.zeroDopplerTimeSpacing: Time interval in the along-track direction for raster layers. This is same as the spacing between consecutive entries in the zeroDopplerTime array

frequencyA.listOfPolarizations: List of processed polarization layers with frequency A
frequencyA.sceneCenterAlongTrackSpacing: Nominal along-track spacing in meters between consecutive lines near mid swath of the RSLC image
frequencyA.sceneCenterGroundRangeSpacing: Nominal ground range spacing in meters between consecutive pixels near mid swath of the RSLC image
frequencyA.acquiredRangeBandwidth: Acquisition range bandwidth in hertz. In case of mode combination, this corresponds to mode with largest bandwidth
frequencyA.nominalAcquisitionPRF: Nominal PRF of acquisition. In case of mode combination, this corresponds to mode with least nominal PRF
frequencyA.processedCenterFrequency: Center frequency of the processed image in hertz
frequencyA.acquiredCenterFrequency: Center frequency of the acquisition in hertz. In case of mode combination, this corresponds to the mode with highest center frequency
frequencyA.slantRangeSpacing: Slant range spacing of grid. Same as difference between consecutive samples in slantRange array
frequencyA.numberOfSubSwaths: Number of swaths of continuous imagery, due to transmit gaps
frequencyA.validSamplesSubSwath1: First and last valid sample in each line of 1st subswath
frequencyA.validSamplesSubSwath2: First and last valid sample in each line of 2nd subswath
frequencyA.validSamplesSubSwath3: First and last valid sample in each line of 3rd subswath
frequencyA.validSamplesSubSwath4: First and last valid sample in each line of 4th subswath
frequencyA.validSamplesSubSwath5: First and last valid sample in each line of 5th subswath

frequencyB.listOfPolarizations: List of processed polarization layers with frequency B
frequencyB.sceneCenterAlongTrackSpacing: Nominal along-track spacing in meters between consecutive lines near mid swath of the RSLC image
frequencyB.sceneCenterGroundRangeSpacing: Nominal ground range spacing in meters between consecutive pixels near mid swath of the RSLC image
frequencyB.acquiredRangeBandwidth: Acquisition range bandwidth in hertz. In case of mode combination, this corresponds to mode with largest bandwidth
frequencyB.nominalAcquisitionPRF: Nominal PRF of acquisition. In case of mode combination, this corresponds to mode with least nominal PRF
frequencyB.processedCenterFrequency: Center frequency of the processed image in hertz
frequencyB.acquiredCenterFrequency: Center frequency of the acquisition in hertz. In case of mode combination, this corresponds to the mode with highest center frequency
frequencyB.slantRangeSpacing: Slant range spacing of grid. Same as difference between consecutive samples in slantRange array
frequencyB.numberOfSubSwaths: Number of swaths of continuous imagery, due to transmit gaps
frequencyB.validSamplesSubSwath1: First and last valid sample in each line of 1st subswath
frequencyB.validSamplesSubSwath2: First and last valid sample in each line of 2nd subswath
frequencyB.validSamplesSubSwath3: First and last valid sample in each line of 3rd subswath
frequencyB.validSamplesSubSwath4: First and last valid sample in each line of 4th subswath
frequencyB.validSamplesSubSwath5: First and last valid sample in each line of 5th subswath

geometry.zeroDopplerTime: Vector of zero Doppler azimuth times, measured relative to a UTC epoch, corresponding to calibration records
geometry.slantRange: Slant range dimension corresponding to calibration records
geometry.beta0: 2D LUT to convert DN to beta 0 assuming as a function of zero Doppler time and slant range
geometry.sigma0: 2D LUT to convert DN to sigma 0 assuming as a function of zero Doppler time and slant range
geometry.gamma0: 2D LUT to convert DN to gamma 0 as a function of zero Doppler time and slant range

elevationAntennaPattern.zeroDopplerTime: Vector of zero Doppler azimuth times, measured relative to a UTC epoch, corresponding to calibration elevationAntennaPattern records
elevationAntennaPattern.slantRange: Slant range dimension corresponding to calibration elevationAntennaPattern records

noiseEquivalentBackscatter.zeroDopplerTime: Vector of zero Doppler azimuth times, measured relative to a UTC epoch, corresponding to calibration noiseEquivalentBackscatter records
noiseEquivalentBackscatter.slantRange: Slant range dimension corresponding to calibration noiseEquivalentBackscatter records
noiseEquivalentBackscatter.HH: Noise equivalent backscatter in linear scale (units of DN^2)
noiseEquivalentBackscatter.HV: Noise equivalent backscatter in linear scale (units of DN^2)
noiseEquivalentBackscatter.VH: Noise equivalent backscatter in linear scale (units of DN^2)
noiseEquivalentBackscatter.VV: Noise equivalent backscatter in linear scale (units of DN^2)
noiseEquivalentBackscatter.RH: Noise equivalent backscatter in linear scale (units of DN^2)
noiseEquivalentBackscatter.RV: Noise equivalent backscatter in linear scale (units of DN^2)

frequencyA.commonDelay: Range delay correction applied to all polarimetric channels
frequencyA.faradayRotation: Faraday rotation correction applied in processing

HH.rfiLikelihood: Severity of radio frequency interference (RFI) contamination in the data. Value is in the interval [0,1], where 0: lowest severity, and 1: highest severity (or NaN if RFI detection was skipped)
HH.differentialDelay: Range delay correction applied to HH channel
HH.differentialPhase: Phase correction applied to HH channel
HH.scaleFactor: Scale factor applied to HH channel complex amplitude (at antenna boresite)
HH.scaleFactorSlope: Slope of scale factor applied to HH channel complex amplitude with respect to elevation angle

HV.rfiLikelihood: Severity of radio frequency interference (RFI) contamination in the data. Value is in the interval [0,1], where 0: lowest severity, and 1: highest severity (or NaN if RFI detection was skipped)
HV.differentialDelay: Range delay correction applied to HV channel
HV.differentialPhase: Phase correction applied to HV channel
HV.scaleFactor: Scale factor applied to HV channel complex amplitude (at antenna boresite)
HV.scaleFactorSlope: Slope of scale factor applied to HV channel complex amplitude with respect to elevation angle

VH.rfiLikelihood: Severity of radio frequency interference (RFI) contamination in the data. Value is in the interval [0,1], where 0: lowest severity, and 1: highest severity (or NaN if RFI detection was skipped)
VH.differentialDelay: Range delay correction applied to VH channel
VH.differentialPhase: Phase correction applied to VH channel
VH.scaleFactor: Scale factor applied to VH channel complex amplitude (at antenna boresite)
VH.scaleFactorSlope: Slope of scale factor applied to VH channel complex amplitude with respect to elevation angle

VV.rfiLikelihood: Severity of radio frequency interference (RFI) contamination in the data. Value is in the interval [0,1], where 0: lowest severity, and 1: highest severity (or NaN if RFI detection was skipped)
VV.differentialDelay: Range delay correction applied to VV channel
VV.differentialPhase: Phase correction applied to VV channel
VV.scaleFactor: Scale factor applied to VV channel complex amplitude (at antenna boresite)
VV.scaleFactorSlope: Slope of scale factor applied to VV channel complex amplitude with respect to elevation angle

RH.rfiLikelihood: Severity of radio frequency interference (RFI) contamination in the data. Value is in the interval [0,1], where 0: lowest severity, and 1: highest severity (or NaN if RFI detection was skipped)
RH.differentialDelay: Range delay correction applied to RH channel
RH.differentialPhase: Phase correction applied to RH channel
RH.scaleFactor: Scale factor applied to RH channel complex amplitude (at antenna boresite)
RH.scaleFactorSlope: Slope of scale factor applied to RH channel complex amplitude with respect to elevation angle

RV.rfiLikelihood: Severity of radio frequency interference (RFI) contamination in the data. Value is in the interval [0,1], where 0: lowest severity, and 1: highest severity (or NaN if RFI detection was skipped)
RV.differentialDelay: Range delay correction applied to RV channel
RV.differentialPhase: Phase correction applied to RV channel
RV.scaleFactor: Scale factor applied to RV channel complex amplitude (at antenna boresite)
RV.scaleFactorSlope: Slope of scale factor applied to RV channel complex amplitude with respect to elevation angle

elevationAntennaPattern.zeroDopplerTime: Vector of zero Doppler azimuth times, measured relative to a UTC epoch, corresponding to calibration elevationAntennaPattern records
elevationAntennaPattern.slantRange: Slant range dimension corresponding to calibration elevationAntennaPattern records

noiseEquivalentBackscatter.HH: Noise equivalent backscatter in linear scale (units of DN^2)
noiseEquivalentBackscatter.zeroDopplerTime: Vector of zero Doppler azimuth times, measured relative to a UTC epoch, corresponding to calibration noiseEquivalentBackscatter records
noiseEquivalentBackscatter.slantRange: Slant range dimension corresponding to calibration noiseEquivalentBackscatter records
noiseEquivalentBackscatter.HV: Noise equivalent backscatter in linear scale (units of DN^2)
noiseEquivalentBackscatter.VH: Noise equivalent backscatter in linear scale (units of DN^2)
noiseEquivalentBackscatter.VV: Noise equivalent backscatter in linear scale (units of DN^2)
noiseEquivalentBackscatter.RH: Noise equivalent backscatter in linear scale (units of DN^2)
noiseEquivalentBackscatter.RV: Noise equivalent backscatter in linear scale (units of DN^2)

HH.differentialDelay: Range delay correction applied to HH channel

HV.scaleFactorSlope: Slope of scale factor applied to HV channel complex amplitude with respect to elevation angle

VH.differentialDelay: Range delay correction applied to VH channel

frequencyB.commonDelay: Range delay correction applied to all polarimetric channels
frequencyB.faradayRotation: Faraday rotation correction applied in processing

crosstalk.slantRange: Slant range dimension corresponding to crosstalk records
crosstalk.txHorizontalCrosspol: Crosstalk in H-transmit channel expressed as ratio txV / txH
crosstalk.txVerticalCrosspol: Crosstalk in V-transmit channel expressed as ratio txH / txV
crosstalk.rxHorizontalCrosspol: Crosstalk in H-receive channel expressed as ratio rxV / rxH
crosstalk.rxVerticalCrosspol: Crosstalk in V-receive channel expressed as ratio rxH / rxV

parameters.azimuthChirpWeighting: 1D array in frequency domain for azimuth processing. This is used for processing L0B to L1. FFT length=256 (assumed)
parameters.rangeChirpWeighting: 1D array in frequency domain for range processing. This is used for processing L0B to L1. FFT length=256 (assumed)
parameters.referenceTerrainHeight: Reference terrain height as a function of time
parameters.zeroDopplerTime: Vector of zero Doppler azimuth times, measured relative to a UTC epoch, corresponding to processing information records
parameters.slantRange: Slant range dimension corresponding to processing information records

frequencyA.zeroDopplerTime: Vector of zero Doppler azimuth times, measured relative to a UTC epoch, corresponding to processing information records
frequencyA.slantRange: Slant range dimension corresponding to processing information records
frequencyA.dopplerCentroid: 2D LUT of Doppler centroid for frequency A

frequencyB.zeroDopplerTime: Vector of zero Doppler azimuth times, measured relative to a UTC epoch, corresponding to processing information records
frequencyB.slantRange: Slant range dimension corresponding to processing information records
frequencyB.dopplerCentroid: 2D LUT of Doppler centroid for frequency B

parameters.runConfigurationContents: Contents of the run configuration file with parameters used for processing

algorithms.rfiDetection: Algorithm used for radio frequency interference (RFI) detection
algorithms.rfiMitigation: Algorithm used for radio frequency interference (RFI) mitigation, either "ST-EVD" or "FDNF" (or "disabled" if no RFI mitigation was applied)
algorithms.rangeCompression: Algorithm for focusing the data in the range direction
algorithms.elevationAntennaPatternCorrection: Algorithm for calibrating the antenna pattern
algorithms.azimuthPresumming: Algorithm for regridding and filling gaps in the raw data in azimuth
algorithms.azimuthCompression: Algorithm for focusing the data in the azimuth direction

inputs.l0bGranules: List of input L0B products used
inputs.orbitFiles: List of input orbit files used
inputs.attitudeFiles: List of input attitude files used
inputs.auxcalFiles: List of input calibration files used
inputs.configFiles: List of input config files used
inputs.demSource: Description of the input digital elevation model (DEM)

orbit.time: Time vector record. This record contains the time since UTC epoch corresponding to position and velocity records
orbit.position: Position vector record. This record contains the platform position data with respect to WGS84 G1762 reference frame
orbit.velocity: Velocity vector record. This record contains the platform velocity data with respect to WGS84 G1762 reference frame
orbit.orbitType: Orbit product type, either "FOE", "NOE", "MOE", "POE", or "Custom", where "FOE" stands for Forecast Orbit Ephemeris, "NOE" is Near real-time Orbit Ephemeris, "MOE" is Medium precision Orbit Ephemeris, and "POE" is Precise Orbit Ephemeris

attitude.time: Time vector record. This record contains the time since UTC epoch corresponding to attitude and quaternion records
attitude.attitudeType: Attitude type, either "FRP", "NRP", "PRP, or "Custom", where "FRP" stands for Forecast Radar Pointing, "NRP" is Near Real-time Pointing, and "PRP" is Precise Radar Pointing

geolocationGrid.epsg: EPSG code corresponding to coordinate system used for representing geolocation grid
geolocationGrid.coordinateY: Y coordinates in specified EPSG code
geolocationGrid.coordinateX: X coordinates in specified EPSG code
geolocationGrid.incidenceAngle: Incidence angle is defined as the angle between the LOS vector and the normal to the ellipsoid at the target height
geolocationGrid.losUnitVectorX: East component of the line-of-sight (LOS) unit vector, defined from the target to the sensor, expressed in the east-north-up (ENU) coordinate system with its origin at the target location
geolocationGrid.losUnitVectorY: North component of the line-of-sight (LOS) unit vector, defined from the target to the sensor, expressed in the east-north-up (ENU) coordinate system with its origin at the target location
geolocationGrid.alongTrackUnitVectorX: East component of the along-track unit vector at the target location, expressed in the east-north-up (ENU) coordinate system and projected onto the horizontal plane (i.e., excluding the up component)
geolocationGrid.alongTrackUnitVectorY: North component of the along-track unit vector at the target location, expressed in the east-north-up (ENU) coordinate system and projected onto the horizontal plane (i.e., excluding the up component)
geolocationGrid.elevationAngle: Elevation angle is defined as the angle between the LOS vector and the normal to the ellipsoid at the sensor
geolocationGrid.slantRange: Slant range values corresponding to the geolocation grid
geolocationGrid.zeroDopplerTime: Vector of zero Doppler azimuth times, measured relative to a UTC epoch, corresponding to the geolocation grid
geolocationGrid.groundTrackVelocity: Absolute value of the platform velocity scaled at the target height
geolocationGrid.heightAboveEllipsoid: Height values above WGS84 Ellipsoid corresponding to the location grid
